title: Senators back criminal charges against Bolsonaro
content: Senators in Brazil vote to recommend charging the president over his handling of the pandemic.

title: Russia threatens gas supply in Europe's poorest state
content: Moldova has made history by buying gas from somewhere other than Russia. How will the Kremlin react?

title: Sister of UK Bataclan victim: 'We don't hate you'
content: Nick Alexander died at a Paris rock gig during the assault by Islamic State (IS) extremists in 2015.

title: Clinton aide details sexual assault by US senator
content: In a new book, Huma Abedin says she was assaulted after a senator invited her into his home.

title: Why is Julian Assange's case back in court?
content: The US begins its appeal in order to extradite the WikiLeaks founder. We explain how we got here.

title: Footballer Josh Cavallo comes out as gay
content: The Adelaide United footballer has become the only current top-flight male professional to do so.

title: Campaigning Hiroshima survivor dies aged 96
content: Sunao Tsuboi met Barack Obama on his historic visit to the site of the world's first nuclear attack.

title: Hong Kong passes film censorship law
content: Authorities will have the power to ban films deemed to violate China's national security interests.

title: Queen will miss COP26 climate summit
content: Buckingham Palace says the Queen, who has been advised to rest, is "disappointed" not to attend.

title: Australia confirms end to citizen travel ban
content: For the first time in 19 months, Australians will not need an exemption to travel overseas.

title: Sunak unveils spending plans in Budget for 'new age'
content: The chancellor is announcing his plans in the Commons as he faces pressure to help people with rising prices.

title: Spain grants joint custody of dog in rare ruling
content: A lawyer calls the ruling pioneering as her client could declare herself as a "co-carer".

title: Twitter profits slump after settling $809m lawsuit
content: The social media giant paid out after it was accused of misleading investors in 2015.

title: Charlize Theron: We have to share Covid vaccines
content: The actress tells the BBC nations must start sharing jabs to help reach the WHO's vaccination goals.
